intro: Tecticornia medusa, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, star-like clusters, which give it its common name. It is well adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in extreme temperatures. Tecticornia medusa is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and aesthetic appeal.
